sentences.cn: “你会错过《布雷迪一家》的。”——“那有什么了不起。”

sentences.en: Amidst the current bunch of nonentities, he is a towering figure.
sentences.cn: 在当前这帮无足轻重的人里面，他算是鹤立鸡群。

sentences.en: He had left a huge bunch of flowers in her hotel room.
sentences.cn: 他在她的宾馆房间里留了一大束花。

sentences.en: I’ll send her a bunch of flowers.
sentences.cn: 我会给她送去一束鲜花。

sentences.en: Joseph watched a shady-looking bunch playing cards aboard a Mississippi steamer.
sentences.cn: 约瑟夫看到一群可疑的人在密西西比河的一艘轮船上打牌。

sentences.en: Lili had fallen asleep clutching a fat bunch of grapes.
sentences.cn: 莉莉手里抓着一大串葡萄睡着了。

sentences.en: My neighbours are a bunch of busybodies.
sentences.cn: 我的邻居们是一群爱管闲事的人。

sentences.en: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
That saved me a whole bunch of money.
The ancient Egyptians were a clever bunch.
The players were a great bunch.
They're a great bunch of guys.
sentences.cn: 他们是一群很棒的小伙子。

sentences.en: We did a bunch of songs together.
sentences.cn: 我们一起唱了很多首歌。

sentences.en: We don't want to look like a bunch of cowboys.
sentences.cn: 我们不想看上去像一帮奸商。

sentences.en: You're all a bunch of bums.

words.tran_cn: 形成一串；隆起；集中（bunch的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: (讽， 主 英)多谢，非常感谢

phrases.phrase: the best (或 the pick) of the bunch

trans.tran_cn: 一伙，一束，一串，大量，群体，发辫
trans.tran_en: a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to pull material together tightly in folds

trans.tran_cn: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束
trans.tran_en: to pull material together tightly in folds
to hold or tie things together in a bunch
